deviceId.description: The SOP ID (Entra ID Device ID) of the managed device to target.
deviceId.name: deviceId

instanceId.description: The Object ID of the parent group for the intermediary that you wish to target.
instanceId.name: instanceId

nextLink.description: Skip token used ton continue with data paging. This token is generated by the MS Graph API and should not be generated by hand. Please only use tokens the server gives you. Please don't bring them from outside. The Graph API is picky.
nextLink.name: nextLink

offeringId.description: Unique identifier of the marketplace offering
offeringId.name: offeringId

schema.description: Unique identifier of the marketplace offering.

securityClass.description: The security class of managed object to retrieve. Unknown values, will be ignored. Please see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/security/compass/privileged-access-security-levels for a description of security levels.
securityClass.name: securityClass

userId.description: The SOP ID (Entra ID User's Object ID) of the managed user to target.
userId.name: userId

401.description: Principal is not authorized to access this endpoint. Check to make sure the Bearer token is valid and present!

404.description: The requested object was not found.

503.description: App is starting still. Feature is not available. Please try again later.

525.description: Infrastructure not deployed. Please deploy the infrastructure before using this endpoint.

Intermediary.description: Base template for all intermediary objects to inherit from.

kind.description: Type of Intermediary that the properties are describing.

name.description: Human friendly name of the AVD cluster. This will be displayed to end users in the remote desktop app and web portals.

Intermediary.title: Intermediary - Base Type

addressRangeCIDR.description: Optional Virtual Network IP Address range, defaults to 10.0.0.0/16.

assignmentGroup.description: Read-only value that the server generates that is the Object ID of the user assignment security group for the current instance of the AVD intermediary.

index.description: Used to uniquely name multiple session hosts in a single host pool.

location.description: Azure Regions that are available for the configured subscription. Resources will be deployed to the region specified here.

resourceId.description: ID of the Host Pool. This is generated by the server and can't be set, hence the read only flag.

sessionHostGroup.description: Read-only value that the server generates that is the Object ID of the session host security group for the current instance of the AVD intermediary.

sessionHostPrefix.description: Short name to append to the beginning of the session host VMs. The max computer name length is 15, 4 chars are reserved for indexing and 4 for prefixing.

vmSku.description: SKU ID in Azure of the VM session host set that is to be deployed.

ManagedDevice.description: A computed device object. This is generated by combining multiple pieces of metadata.

commissionedDate.description: This is the ISO 8601 string format of the time representing the commission date of the PAW.

displayName.description: Current computer name of the device according to Entra ID. Empty string indicates that the device has not joined Entra ID yet

groupAssignment.description: This is the ID of the Custom CSP Device Configuration that configures the local admin and local hyper-v group memberships.

parentDevice.description: DeviceID of the parent PAW device.

uniqueGroup.description: The object ID of the unique security group that contains the managed Entra ID Device Identity.

userAssignment.description: The ID of the Settings Catalog that contains the user rights assignment of the specified PAW device.

ManagedDevice.title: Managed Device Object

ManagedUser.description: A user object that has limited properties. The user object is generated by combining multiple pieces of metadata from Entra ID and SOP.

creationDate.description: A date object representing when the user managed by SOP.

displayName.description: The name shown on UIs for the privileged user according to Entra ID.

firstName.description: Given name of the privileged user according to Entra ID.

generatedPassword.description: The password that was created for the managed user upon managed user creation, this is not stored. This is only available once during user creation. If the password is lost, reset the PWD in Entra ID or have the user perform SSPR.

lastName.description: Surname/family name of the privileged user according to Entra ID.

parentId.description: The Entra ID Object ID of the object that the manged user is tied to. This value is only present on privileged users.

uiEducation.description: Indicates if user education is enabled in the UI for the specified user. True is on, false is off.

uniqueGroup.description: ObjectID of the unique user group that the managed user is a member of.

upn.description: User principal name of the user object according to Azure Active Directory.

ManagedUser.title: Managed User Object

SecurityClassList.description: Security class types as described in https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/security/compass/privileged-access-security-levels.
SecurityClassList.title: Type of security class the object(s) belongs to

EntraID.description: The Access Token from Entra ID for the App ID of `ID HERE`.

info.description: Deprive your threats of practical significance. Deploy the Securing Privilege Access architecture. All in a few seconds.
info.title: SHI Orchestration Platform

get.description: Provides the Tenant ID and the Application ID of the service principal that access tokens need to be issued against. This is also useful for configuring public clients to be able to authenticate to for auth code flows.

Tenant Configuration.description: All API calls should be available since the core infrastructure is deployed.

appId.description: Application ID that should be used in Access Tokens as the audience and the endpoint necessary for auth code flows.

Application ID Example.description: Application ID is not the Object ID of the service principal.

tenantId.description: Tenant ID necessary for authority host URL configuration and UI customization.

get.summary: Retrieves the IDs required to authenticate.

get.description: Has the core infrastructure engine check if the config engine can initialize properly.

infra deployed.description: All API calls should be available since the core infrastructure is deployed.

Infra not deployed.description: Infrastructure is not deployed. Please run the deployment before attempting different API calls.

get.summary: Get the current status of the infrastructure deployment

post.description: After the user consents, deploy the core security groups, scope tag, configurations and metadata.

Ignorant Deploy Request.description: Clueless dev trying to automate this application without reading the docs. RTFM!

No User Consent.description: User did not agree to the terms and conditions. This post should not have been sent.

User Consented.description: User agreed to the terms and conditions and pressed the deploy button.

Successful Deployment.description: When a deployment request is successfully executed, a boolean true is returned.

post.summary: Deploy the core infrastructure architecture specification

get.description: Gets the version of the API server and the architecture version deployed as well as the supported version of the architecture spec from the server.

apiVersion.description: Follows symantec versioning as laid out here: https://semver.org/. This number is the version of the API server.

archSpecVersion.description: An incrementing number that describes the version of the architecture specification that the API supports.

deployedArchVersion.description: The version of the architecture specification that is currently deployed.

get.summary: Gets the version of SOPs components

get.description: Retrieves a list of all AVD intermediaries for the specified security class filter. Next links may be provided for pagination to allow for good performance on larger environments. If a nextLink is return, not all data was returned on this query and the next link can be sent back to the API to get the next page of data.

delete.description: Deletes the specified intermediary (by the parent group's Entra ID Object ID) using the requested security class as a filter.
delete.summary: Deletes a Single AVD Intermediary Instance

get.description: Retrieves the specified intermediary (by the parent group's Entra ID Object ID) using the requested security class as a filter.
get.summary: Retrieves a Single AVD Intermediary Instance

delete.description: Removes the specified user(s) as identified by their Object ID from the AVD cluster and deletes their corresponding session host(s).

One user.description: Removes 1 session host, and removed the requested user from the assignments security group.

Two users.description: Removes 3 session hosts, and removed the requested users from the assignments security group.

delete.summary: Removes the assignment of the specified users

get.description: Gets the list of assigned user from the specified AVD Intermediary.

post.description: Assigns the specified user(s) as identified by their Object ID to the AVD cluster and create corresponding session host(s) for them.

One user.description: Creates 1 session host, and added the requested user to the assignments security group.

Two users.description: Creates 3 session hosts, and added the requested users to the assignments security group.

post.summary: Assigns the list of specified users

get.description: Get the specified managed user's from the specified AVD intermediary assignment list.

delete.description: Remove the specified user list from the device.

Multiple Users.description: Remove multiple user assignments from a managed device.

Single User.description: Remove a single user assignment from a managed device.

get.description: Lists all of the users that are currently assigned to the specified device.

post.description: Adds the specified list of users to the list of users that are allowed to log in on the specific privileged device.

1:1 map.description: This example is the security best practice of having only one user mapped to a managed device.

Multi-User Managed Device.description: This example is the security best practice of having only one user mapped to a managed device.

get.description: Returns a list of all commissioned devices managed by the SHI Orchestration Platform app.
get.summary: Get a list of all managed devices

post.description: Commissions a new device, into the device hierarchy and appends appropriate metadata and initial policies. Appends required metadata to proper locations.

delete.description: Removes the device from the management hierarchy, removes metadata tagging and issues the wipe command to the devices.

get.description: Get the specified managed device by its Entra ID Device ID.
get.summary: Get the specified device by its ID

get.description: Returns a list of all users managed by the SHI Orchestration Platform app.
get.summary: Get a list of all managed users.

post.description: Securely clones the specified user's properties into a new managed user object.

userId.description: The Entra ID object ID of the user to clone.

post.summary: Create a new managed user with the based on the user ID specified.

delete.description: Deletes the user account and removes the management artifacts.

get.description: Retrieves the specified managed user by its Entra ID User ID

patch.description: Updates the user's mutable data such as their display name, uiEducation or first/last name. All other properties passed will be ignored.
patch.summary: Update a managed user with the specified data.

get.description: Lists all of the available marketplace offerings along with their metadata.

post.description: Creates the offering with the requested settings. In the body payload, the `type` property in the `property` object is ignored. See the AVD example.

Azure Virtual Desktop.description: Deploys an AVD cluster that is connected to the device configurations system in SOP. The type property can be omitted because it is passed via path parameter.

get.description: Runs the Swagger UI render to render the OpenAPI spec that you are viewing now.

200.description: Returns the HTML for Swagger UI renderer's output

servers.description: A secured connection to the app, only secured connections should be used for production.
Used only for local dev, never host this app without network encryption.

tags.description: Used to manage UI and API authentication.
tags.name: Authentication

tags.description: Manages the lifecycle of the various intermediary system types.
tags.name: Intermediary

tags.description: Metadata and deployment management for market offerings. Lifecycle management is not handled in this route.
tags.name: Marketplace

tags.description: Checks the status and starts deployment of the core infrastructure.
tags.name: Infrastructure Deployment

tags.description: WARNING AUTHENTICATION IS DISABLED IN DEBUG MODE!!! Endpoints that are exposed only in debug mode. You can use these to see as the app sees.
tags.name: Debug Mode
